Unnamed: 1: 205-1 Operations assessed for risks related to corruption
Unnamed: 2: For operations within standard business across the Group, we conduct risk assessments, incident investigations where relevant, internal and external audits of financial data, among other processes. Operations within the supply chain are covered by a dedicated Human Rights team.

Unnamed: 1: 205-2 Communication and training about anti-corruption policies and procedures
Unnamed: 2: Our Code of Conduct, Fraud, Anti-Bribery and Corruption Policy and team member Speak Up Program is communicated to all team members through mandatory training. All policies are available on the team member intranet. The implementation of policy commitments is supported by our Culture and People team and People Services, dedicated teams that provide specialised advice to team members on human resources issues

Unnamed: 1: 205-3 Confirmed incidents of corruption and actions taken
Unnamed: 2: During FY23, there were a small number of instances where certain Woolworths team members were found to not have complied with Woolworths' Fraud, Anti-bribery and Corruption policy. These incidents were non-systemic and resolved with disciplinary action.

Unnamed: 1: 206-1 Legal actions for anti-competitive behavior, anti-trust, and monopoly practices
Unnamed: 2: There was no legal action taken during the reporting period for anti-competitive behaviour, anti-trust or monopoly practices by Woolworths Group Limited or its employees.

Unnamed: 1: 302-2 Energy consumption outside of the organization
Unnamed: 2: 2023 Sustainability data pack - Scope 3 emissions\n\nEstimated scope 3 emissions footprint primarily based on emission factors extrapolated from goods and services sold to consumers
Unnamed: 5: Woolworths Group report energy consumption outside of the organisation converted to tCO2e aligned with NGER Measurement Determination, NZ Ministry for the Environment - 2022 Emissions Measurement Guide and NGA emission factors. The scope of the indicator includes energy consumed from third party logistics only and consequently do not report on other energy consumption indicators based on the nature of Woolworths Group principal activities and operations\nScope 3 estimates not made at a joule level using current processes. Methodology and conversion factors are specific to each category within scope 3 and are subject to further change as standards, data and processes mature
